newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: Lithuanian share index dips amid active trade.
newsitem.headline: Lithuanian share index dips amid active trade.

text.p: The leading index of the Lithuanian stock exchange suffered a setback on Thursday amid active trade, the Vilnius bourse said.
The group A index, which covers the 33 most active stocks, dipped around 29 percent to 1,414.14 on central market trade of 421,777 litas of business.
The secondary market government T-bill trade was also active, coming in at a high 6.5 million litas.
The Birzhu dairy firm saw good trade of 54,375 litas as it rose to 5.15 litas from five while the Ekranas TV parts maker rose almost 20 percent to 2.59 litas on turnover of 41,797 litas.
The list of banks was also fairly active at 287,595 litas, dominated by one of the Baltic state's leading banks, Hermis Bank. It traded 275,990 litas but dipped slightly to 130 litas from 131 litas.
Some 69,989 litas of block trading was done.
